intro: Sida centuriata, commonly known as Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida centuriata is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
